CHMOD(1) General Commands Manual CHMOD(1)

NAME

chmod — change file mode bits

SYNOPSIS

chmod [-Rv] mode file ...

DESCRIPTION

The chmod utility modifies the file mode bits of the listed files as specified by the mode operand.

The options are as follows:

-R
Recursively change file mode bits. For each file operand that names a directory, chmod changes the file mode bits of the directory and all files in the file hierarchy below it.
-v
Verbose mode. Explain what is being done.

The mode may be either an octal number or a symbolic value.

An octal mode is specified with three or four octal digits (0-7):

4000
Set-user-ID on execution
2000
Set-group-ID on execution
1000
Sticky bit
0400
Read by owner
0200
Write by owner
0100
Execute by owner
0040
Read by group
0020
Write by group
0010
Execute by group
0004
Read by others
0002
Write by others
0001
Execute by others

A symbolic mode has the form:

[who] op [perm]

The who symbols are:

u
User (owner) permissions
g
Group permissions
o
Other permissions
a
All permissions (equivalent to ugo)

The op symbols are:

+
Add permissions
-
Remove permissions
=
Set permissions explicitly

The perm symbols are:

r
Read permission
w
Write permission
x
Execute permission
X
Execute only if file is a directory or already has execute permission
s
Set-user-ID or set-group-ID
t
Sticky bit

EXAMPLES

Make a file executable by the owner:

$ chmod u+x script.sh

Remove write permission for group and others:

$ chmod go-w document.txt

Set specific permissions using octal notation:

$ chmod 755 program

Recursively make all files in a directory tree readable by everyone:

$ chmod -R a+r project/

EXIT STATUS

The chmod utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.

SEE ALSO

chown(1), ls(1)

STANDARDS

The chmod utility is compliant with the IEEE Std 1003.1-2008 (“POSIX.1”) specification.

HISTORY

A chmod command appeared in Version 1 AT&T UNIX.

AUTHORS

vibeutils implementation by
Travis Cole

CAVEATS

Only the file's owner or the superuser may change a file's mode.

The -R option does not follow symbolic links.

August 2, 2025 macOS 15.6
